decks.notes: The main objective of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing Zurgo Bellstriker as the commander. The deck focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent through a wide array of burn spells and low-cost, hasty creatures. With a mana base consisting mostly of Mountains and Snow-Covered Mountains, the deck aims to quickly establish a strong board presence and control the pace of the game. Cards like Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, and Searing Blaze are key in dealing damage efficiently, while creatures such as Goblin Guide, Monastery Swiftspear, and Hellspark Elemental provide continuous pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around quick, aggressive plays and direct damage to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on maintaining control of the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while utilizing the powerful abilities of Dragonlord Ojutai as the commander. With a mix of efficient counterspells, board wipes, and card draw spells, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies and protect its own threats. The inclusion of utility lands like Maze of Ith and Minamo, School at Water's Edge provides additional defensive options, while powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Elspeth, Sun's Champion offer versatile ways to gain advantage. The deck's strategy revolves around outmaneuvering opponents with strong control elements and closing out the game with Dragonlord Ojutai's potent abilities.

This deck focuses on assembling a fast and aggressive board presence using a variety of efficient creatures and mana dorks. Saskia the Unyielding serves as the commander, allowing for additional damage to be dealt to opponents. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Voice of Resurgence, and Wild Nacatl, as well as versatile removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile. Additionally, the deck utilizes efficient mana acceleration through cards like Birds of Paradise and Llanowar Elves to ramp into larger threats quickly. By putting continuous pressure on opponents and utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents and secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game and manipulate the board state using counterspells, bounce spells, and card draw to slow down the opponent and outvalue them in the late game. With Venser, Shaper Savant as the commander, the deck aims to bounce important threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck includes a variety of control elements such as counterspells, draw spells, and bounce effects to maintain control of the game. The win condition of the deck is to generate card advantage, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and eventually win through overwhelming the opponent with powerful spells and creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Torrential Gearhulk.

This deck focuses on efficiently using artifacts to control the board and disrupt the opponent while also building up an aggressive board presence. By combining blue, white, black, and red colors, the commanders Silas Renn and Akiri offer a versatile and synergistic approach to commanding the deck. The deck includes a mix of powerful spells and artifacts to handle threats and enable quick victories. Key cards like Spellskite and Cranial Plating help protect and boost your creatures, while cards like Thoughtseize and Duress disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck aims to establish early control through disruption and then quickly close out the game with aggressive plays and powerful threats.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal, counterspells, and hand disruption. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by using cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Hymn to Tourach to take important cards from their hand. It also includes a variety of removal spells like Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt, and Dreadbore to deal with threats on the board. The deck's counterspell suite, including Counterspell, Force of Will, and Negate, allows it to counter key spells and protect its own game plan. With Kess, Dissident Mage as the commander, the deck gains additional value by being able to recast powerful instant and sorcery spells from the graveyard.

The deck focuses on utilizing the partner commanders Tymna the Weaver and Kraum, Ludevic's Opus to maintain card advantage and apply pressure on the opponent. It includes a mix of efficient removal spells, counterspells, card draw, and versatile threats to control the game and quickly close it out. The mana base is optimized for consistency and versatility, allowing the deck to access a wide range of powerful spells. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing your own board presence, ultimately overwhelming them with threats and answers to secure the win.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy using Saskia the Unyielding as the commander. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, powerful creatures, and mana ramp to quickly pressure opponents. The key concept is to efficiently deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying consistent pressure. With a diverse selection of creatures and versatile removal spells, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents early in the game and maintain a strong board presence. By utilizing a combination of efficient removal, resilient creatures, and ramp spells, the deck seeks to close out games quickly before opponents can stabilize.
